detaileddescription.para: Enables pin as input.
Enables pin as output, no change to the output state.
Disables pin for both input and output.
Configures GPIO pin as output and initializes it to a low state.
Configures GPIO pin as output and initializes it to a high state.
Configures GPIO pin as output and initializes it to a logic 0.
Configures GPIO pin as output and initializes it to a logic 1.

description.para: The GPIO_INT_* flags are used to specify how input GPIO pins will trigger interrupts. The interrupts can be sensitive to pin physical or logical level. Interrupts sensitive to pin logical level take into account GPIO_ACTIVE_LOW flag. If a pin was configured as Active Low, physical level low will be considered as logical level 1 (an active state), physical level high will be considered as logical level 0 (an inactive state).

detaileddescription.para: Disables GPIO pin interrupt.
Configures GPIO interrupt to be triggered on pin rising edge and enables it.
Configures GPIO interrupt to be triggered on pin falling edge and enables it.
Configures GPIO interrupt to be triggered on pin rising or falling edge and enables it.
Configures GPIO interrupt to be triggered on pin physical level low and enables it.
Configures GPIO interrupt to be triggered on pin physical level high and enables it.
Configures GPIO interrupt to be triggered on pin state change to logical level 0 and enables it.
Configures GPIO interrupt to be triggered on pin state change to logical level 1 and enables it.
Configures GPIO interrupt to be triggered on pin logical level 0 and enables it.
Configures GPIO interrupt to be triggered on pin logical level 1 and enables it.

description.para: The GPIO_DS_* flags are used with gpio_pin_configure to specify the drive strength configuration of a GPIO pin.
The drive strength of individual pins can be configured independently for when the pin output is low and high.
The GPIO_DS_*_LOW enumerations define the drive strength of a pin when output is low.
The GPIO_DS_*_HIGH enumerations define the drive strength of a pin when output is high.
The interface supports two different drive strengths: DFLT - The lowest drive strength supported by the HW ALT - The highest drive strength supported by the HW
On hardware that supports only one standard drive strength, both DFLT and ALT have the same behavior.

detaileddescription.para: Default drive strength standard when GPIO pin output is low.
Alternative drive strength when GPIO pin output is low. For hardware that does not support configurable drive strength use the default drive strength.
Default drive strength when GPIO pin output is high.
Alternative drive strength when GPIO pin output is high. For hardware that does not support configurable drive strengths use the default drive strength.
Combined default drive strength.
Combined alternative drive strength.
GPIO pin is active (has logical value '1') in low state.
GPIO pin is active (has logical value '1') in high state.
Configures GPIO output in open drain mode (wired AND).

simplesect.para: 'Open Drain' mode also known as 'Open Collector' is an output configuration which behaves like a switch that is either connected to ground or disconnected.

detaileddescription.para: Configures GPIO output in open source mode (wired OR).

simplesect.para: 'Open Source' is a term used by software engineers to describe output mode opposite to 'Open Drain'. It behaves like a switch that is either connected to power supply or disconnected. There exist no corresponding hardware schematic and the term is generally unknown to hardware engineers.

detaileddescription.para: Enables GPIO pin pull-up.
Enable GPIO pin pull-down.

description.para: The voltage flags are a Zephyr specific extension of the standard GPIO flags specified by the Linux GPIO binding. Only applicable if SoC allows to configure pin voltage per individual pin.

detaileddescription.para: Set pin at the default voltage level
Set pin voltage level at 1.8 V
Set pin voltage level at 3.3 V
Set pin voltage level at 5.0 V

briefdescription.para: Identifies a set of pins associated with a port.

detaileddescription.para: The pin with index n is present in the set if and only if the bit identified by (1U << n) is set.

briefdescription.para: Provides values for a set of pins associated with a port.

detaileddescription.para: The value for a pin with index n is high (physical mode) or active (logical mode) if and only if the bit identified by (1U << n) is set. Otherwise the value for the pin is low (physical mode) or inactive (logical mode).
Values of this type are often paired with a gpio_port_pins_t value that specifies which encoded pin values are valid for the operation.

briefdescription.para: Provides a type to hold a GPIO pin index.

detaileddescription.para: This reduced-size type is sufficient to record a pin number, e.g. from a devicetree GPIOS property.

briefdescription.para: Provides a type to hold GPIO devicetree flags.

detaileddescription.para: All GPIO flags that can be expressed in devicetree fit in the low 8 bits of the full flags field, so use a reduced-size type to record that part of a GPIOS property.

briefdescription.para: Provides a type to hold GPIO configuration flags.

detaileddescription.para: This type is sufficient to hold all flags used to control GPIO configuration, whether pin or interrupt.

memberdef.argsstring: )(const struct device *port, struct gpio_callback *cb, gpio_port_pins_t pins)
memberdef.name: gpio_callback_handler_t

briefdescription.para: Define the application callback handler function signature.

detaileddescription.para:
port
Device struct for the GPIO device.
cb
Original struct gpio_callback owning this handler
pins
Mask of pins that triggers the callback handler
Note: cb pointer can be used to retrieve private data through CONTAINER_OF() if original struct gpio_callback is stored in another private structure.

memberdef.argsstring: (const struct device *port, gpio_pin_t pin, gpio_flags_t flags)
memberdef.name: gpio_pin_interrupt_configure

briefdescription.para: Configure pin interrupt.

simplesect.para: This function can also be used to configure interrupts on pins not controlled directly by the GPIO module. That is, pins which are routed to other modules such as I2C, SPI, UART.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to device structure for the driver instance.
Interrupt configuration flags as defined by GPIO_INT_*.
If any of the configuration options is not supported (unless otherwise directed by flag documentation).
Interrupt line required to configure pin interrupt is already in use.
I/O error when accessing an external GPIO chip.

briefdescription.para: Configure pin interrupts from a gpio_dt_spec.

detaileddescription.para: This is equivalent to: gpio_pin_interrupt_configure(spec->port, spec->pin, flags); The spec->dt_flags value is not used.

memberdef.argsstring: (const struct device *port, gpio_pin_t pin, gpio_flags_t flags)
memberdef.name: gpio_pin_configure

briefdescription.para: Configure a single pin.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to device structure for the driver instance.
Flags for pin configuration: 'GPIO input/output configuration flags', 'GPIO drive strength flags', 'GPIO pin drive flags', 'GPIO pin bias flags', GPIO_INT_DEBOUNCE.
if any of the configuration options is not supported (unless otherwise directed by flag documentation).
I/O error when accessing an external GPIO chip.

briefdescription.para: Configure a single pin from a gpio_dt_spec and some extra flags.

detaileddescription.para:
This is equivalent to: gpio_pin_configure(spec->port, spec->pin, spec->dt_flags | extra_flags);
spec
GPIO specification from devicetree
extra_flags
additional flags
a value from gpio_pin_configure()

briefdescription.para: Get physical level of all input pins in a port.

detaileddescription.para: A low physical level on the pin will be interpreted as value 0. A high physical level will be interpreted as value 1. This function ignores GPIO_ACTIVE_LOW flag.
Value of a pin with index n will be represented by bit n in the returned port value.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the device structure for the driver instance.
Pointer to a variable where pin values will be stored.
I/O error when accessing an external GPIO chip.

briefdescription.para: Get logical level of all input pins in a port.

detaileddescription.para: Get logical level of an input pin taking into account GPIO_ACTIVE_LOW flag. If pin is configured as Active High, a low physical level will be interpreted as logical value 0. If pin is configured as Active Low, a low physical level will be interpreted as logical value 1.
Value of a pin with index n will be represented by bit n in the returned port value.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the device structure for the driver instance.
Pointer to a variable where pin values will be stored.
I/O error when accessing an external GPIO chip.

memberdef.argsstring: (const struct device *port, gpio_port_pins_t mask, gpio_port_value_t value)
memberdef.name: gpio_port_set_masked_raw

briefdescription.para: Set physical level of output pins in a port.

detaileddescription.para: Writing value 0 to the pin will set it to a low physical level. Writing value 1 will set it to a high physical level. This function ignores GPIO_ACTIVE_LOW flag.
Pin with index n is represented by bit n in mask and value parameter.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the device structure for the driver instance.
Mask indicating which pins will be modified.
Value assigned to the output pins.
I/O error when accessing an external GPIO chip.

memberdef.argsstring: (const struct device *port, gpio_port_pins_t mask, gpio_port_value_t value)
memberdef.name: gpio_port_set_masked

briefdescription.para: Set logical level of output pins in a port.

detaileddescription.para: Set logical level of an output pin taking into account GPIO_ACTIVE_LOW flag. Value 0 sets the pin in logical 0 / inactive state. Value 1 sets the pin in logical 1 / active state. If pin is configured as Active High, the default, setting it in inactive state will force the pin to a low physical level. If pin is configured as Active Low, setting it in inactive state will force the pin to a high physical level.
Pin with index n is represented by bit n in mask and value parameter.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the device structure for the driver instance.
Mask indicating which pins will be modified.
Value assigned to the output pins.
I/O error when accessing an external GPIO chip.

briefdescription.para: Set physical level of selected output pins to high.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the device structure for the driver instance.
Value indicating which pins will be modified.
I/O error when accessing an external GPIO chip.

briefdescription.para: Set logical level of selected output pins to active.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the device structure for the driver instance.
Value indicating which pins will be modified.
I/O error when accessing an external GPIO chip.

briefdescription.para: Set physical level of selected output pins to low.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the device structure for the driver instance.
Value indicating which pins will be modified.
I/O error when accessing an external GPIO chip.

briefdescription.para: Set logical level of selected output pins to inactive.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the device structure for the driver instance.
Value indicating which pins will be modified.
I/O error when accessing an external GPIO chip.

briefdescription.para: Toggle level of selected output pins.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the device structure for the driver instance.
Value indicating which pins will be modified.
I/O error when accessing an external GPIO chip.

memberdef.argsstring: (const struct device *port, gpio_port_pins_t set_pins, gpio_port_pins_t clear_pins)
memberdef.name: gpio_port_set_clr_bits_raw

briefdescription.para: Set physical level of selected output pins.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the device structure for the driver instance.
Value indicating which pins will be set to high.
Value indicating which pins will be set to low.
I/O error when accessing an external GPIO chip.

memberdef.argsstring: (const struct device *port, gpio_port_pins_t set_pins, gpio_port_pins_t clear_pins)
memberdef.name: gpio_port_set_clr_bits

briefdescription.para: Set logical level of selected output pins.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the device structure for the driver instance.
Value indicating which pins will be set to active.
Value indicating which pins will be set to inactive.
I/O error when accessing an external GPIO chip.

briefdescription.para: Get physical level of an input pin.

detaileddescription.para: A low physical level on the pin will be interpreted as value 0. A high physical level will be interpreted as value 1. This function ignores GPIO_ACTIVE_LOW flag.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the device structure for the driver instance.
If pin physical level is high.
If pin physical level is low.
I/O error when accessing an external GPIO chip.

briefdescription.para: Get logical level of an input pin.

detaileddescription.para: Get logical level of an input pin taking into account GPIO_ACTIVE_LOW flag. If pin is configured as Active High, a low physical level will be interpreted as logical value 0. If pin is configured as Active Low, a low physical level will be interpreted as logical value 1.
Note: If pin is configured as Active High, the default, gpio_pin_get() function is equivalent to gpio_pin_get_raw().

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the device structure for the driver instance.
If pin logical value is 1 / active.
If pin logical value is 0 / inactive.
I/O error when accessing an external GPIO chip.

briefdescription.para: Get logical level of an input pin from a gpio_dt_spec.

detaileddescription.para:
This is equivalent to: gpio_pin_get(spec->port, spec->pin);
spec
GPIO specification from devicetree
a value from gpio_pin_get()

memberdef.argsstring: (const struct device *port, gpio_pin_t pin, int value)
memberdef.name: gpio_pin_set_raw

briefdescription.para: Set physical level of an output pin.

detaileddescription.para: Writing value 0 to the pin will set it to a low physical level. Writing any value other than 0 will set it to a high physical level. This function ignores GPIO_ACTIVE_LOW flag.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the device structure for the driver instance.
I/O error when accessing an external GPIO chip.

memberdef.argsstring: (const struct device *port, gpio_pin_t pin, int value)
memberdef.name: gpio_pin_set

briefdescription.para: Set logical level of an output pin.

detaileddescription.para: Set logical level of an output pin taking into account GPIO_ACTIVE_LOW flag. Value 0 sets the pin in logical 0 / inactive state. Any value other than 0 sets the pin in logical 1 / active state. If pin is configured as Active High, the default, setting it in inactive state will force the pin to a low physical level. If pin is configured as Active Low, setting it in inactive state will force the pin to a high physical level.
Note: If pin is configured as Active High, gpio_pin_set() function is equivalent to gpio_pin_set_raw().

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the device structure for the driver instance.
I/O error when accessing an external GPIO chip.

briefdescription.para: Set logical level of a output pin from a gpio_dt_spec.

detaileddescription.para:
This is equivalent to: gpio_pin_set(spec->port, spec->pin, value);
spec
GPIO specification from devicetree
value
Value assigned to the pin.
a value from gpio_pin_set()

briefdescription.para: Toggle pin level.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the device structure for the driver instance.
I/O error when accessing an external GPIO chip.

briefdescription.para: Toggle pin level from a gpio_dt_spec.

detaileddescription.para:
This is equivalent to: gpio_pin_toggle(spec->port, spec->pin);
spec
GPIO specification from devicetree
a value from gpio_pin_toggle()

briefdescription.para: Helper to initialize a struct gpio_callback properly.

parameterdescription.para: A valid Application's callback structure pointer.
A bit mask of relevant pins for the handler

briefdescription.para: Add an application callback.

detaileddescription.para:
port
Pointer to the device structure for the driver instance.
callback
A valid Application's callback structure pointer.
0 if successful, negative errno code on failure.
Callbacks may be added to the device from within a callback handler invocation, but whether they are invoked for the current GPIO event is not specified.
Note: enables to add as many callback as needed on the same port.

briefdescription.para: Remove an application callback.

detaileddescription.para:
port
Pointer to the device structure for the driver instance.
callback
A valid application's callback structure pointer.
0 if successful, negative errno code on failure.
It is explicitly permitted, within a callback handler, to remove the registration for the callback that is running, i.e. callback. Attempts to remove other registrations on the same device may result in undefined behavior, including failure to invoke callbacks that remain registered and unintended invocation of removed callbacks.
Note: enables to remove as many callbacks as added through gpio_add_callback().

briefdescription.para: Function to get pending interrupts.

detaileddescription.para: The purpose of this function is to return the interrupt status register for the device. This is especially useful when waking up from low power states to check the wake up source.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the device structure for the driver instance.
!= 0 if at least one gpio interrupt is pending.
if no gpio interrupt is pending.

detaileddescription.para: Enable GPIO pin debounce.

simplesect.para: Drivers that do not support a debounce feature should ignore this flag rather than rejecting the configuration with -ENOTSUP.

memberdef.name: GPIO_DT_SPEC_GET_BY_IDX
memberdef.initializer: { \ .port = DEVICE_DT_GET(DT_GPIO_CTLR_BY_IDX(node_id, prop, idx)),\ .pin = DT_GPIO_PIN_BY_IDX(node_id, prop, idx), \ .dt_flags = DT_GPIO_FLAGS_BY_IDX(node_id, prop, idx), \ }

briefdescription.para: Static initializer for a gpio_dt_spec.

detaileddescription.para: This returns a static initializer for a gpio_dt_spec structure given a devicetree node identifier, a property specifying a GPIO and an index.

simplesect.para: static initializer for a struct gpio_dt_spec for the property

briefdescription.para: Like GPIO_DT_SPEC_GET_BY_IDX(), with a fallback to a default value.

detaileddescription.para: If the devicetree node identifier 'node_id' refers to a node with a property 'prop', this expands to GPIO_DT_SPEC_GET_BY_IDX(node_id, prop, idx). The default_value parameter is not expanded in this case.
Otherwise, this expands to default_value.

simplesect.para: static initializer for a struct gpio_dt_spec for the property, or default_value if the node or property do not exist

briefdescription.para: Equivalent to GPIO_DT_SPEC_GET_BY_IDX(node_id, prop, 0).

simplesect.para: static initializer for a struct gpio_dt_spec for the property

briefdescription.para: Equivalent to GPIO_DT_SPEC_GET_BY_IDX_OR(node_id, prop, 0, default_value).

simplesect.para: static initializer for a struct gpio_dt_spec for the property

briefdescription.para: Static initializer for a gpio_dt_spec from a DT_DRV_COMPAT instance's GPIO property at an index.

simplesect.para: static initializer for a struct gpio_dt_spec for the property

briefdescription.para: Static initializer for a gpio_dt_spec from a DT_DRV_COMPAT instance's GPIO property at an index, with fallback.

simplesect.para: static initializer for a struct gpio_dt_spec for the property

briefdescription.para: Equivalent to GPIO_DT_SPEC_INST_GET_BY_IDX(inst, prop, 0).

simplesect.para: static initializer for a struct gpio_dt_spec for the property

briefdescription.para: Equivalent to GPIO_DT_SPEC_INST_GET_BY_IDX_OR(inst, prop, 0, default_value).

simplesect.para: static initializer for a struct gpio_dt_spec for the property

briefdescription.para: Maximum number of pins that are supported by gpio_port_pins_t.
GPIO Driver APIs.
